IRS990.Description: Higher Education: Alverno College is an independent college offering a liberal arts curriculum leading to a Bachelor of Arts, Bachelor of Science in Nursing, Bachelor of Science in Education, Bachelor of Music, and/or Associate of Arts degree. Graduate programs for both men and women include a Master of Arts in Education, Master of Business Administration, and/or a Master of Science in Nursing.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: The College engaged a lobbying firm to help arrange meetings with legislators and/or their staffs to discuss possible stimulus funds available for the College.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The art collection donation to the College is 46 paintings from two Wisconsin artists. Alverno College's unique emphasis on learning eight abilities needed to put knowledge to use - commonly called "ability-based education" - has gained national praise. One of the abilities students need to demonstrate is aesthetic engagement which is defined as: engage with various forms of art and in artistic processes, take and defend positions regarding the meaning and value of artistic expressions in the contexts from which they emerge. The art collection will be used for this educational purpose.
The intended uses of the college's endowment funds is to provide scholarships (i.e. financial aid) to students and general support to all of the college's programs.
Tuition discounts and scholarships $11,609,043 and gain of sale of assets $13,400

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: The programs, services, and facilities of the college are available to the general public regardless of race, color, religion, disability, or national origin.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: Alverno College is a women's college and does not accept students into undergraduate degree programs who are not female. In 1979, the College was charged with discrimination because it denied admission to a male applicant for a nursing degree program. In 1980, a conciliation agreement was entered into by the College and the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare, whereby the College agrees that it will neither request or receive Public Health Act funds during such times as the admission policies of the College restrict males from admittance to all programs, in the Department of Nursing.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Selection of students is based on established criteria of each scholarship fund and students are awarded scholarships on account through financial aid.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Board of Directors Gary Grunau and Susan Dragisic have a family relationship.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: This Corporation is owned and operated as a subsidiary of The School Sisters of St. Francis of St. Joseph's Convent, Milwaukee, Wisconsin, Inc., a religious Community of the Roman Catholic Church, by virtue of this Corporation having been organized, governed, and operated by such religious Community and members of such religious Community composing the Corporate Membership of this Corporation.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Corporation shall have Members of no fewer than three (3) in number or more than six (6) in number. They shall be the Provincial Team and Treasurer of the School Sisters of St. Francis, United States Province. The Board of Trustees shall consist of not less than fifteen (15) nor more than forty (40) Trustees as determined from time to time by the Board of Trustees with the approval of the Corporate Membership.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Corporate Members shall have the following powers and duties: a. To adopt or change the mission and to safeguard the purposes of the Corporation; to annually meet with the Board of Trustees and review the functions of the Board of Trustees and the operations of the Corporation in accord with the School Sisters of St. Francis philosophy, values and heritage. b. To appointment of six (6) Trustees to the Board for terms of three (3) years. c. To appoint a School Sister of St. Francis to the committee for the selection of the President of the College; and to approve the slate of nominees for the position of President of the College. d. To approve any amendments, restatements or modifications of the Articles of Incorporation and the Bylaws of the Corporation. e. To approve the Corporation's establishment of another corporation, endowment, foundation, or trust; and to approve such organization's Articles and Bylaws. f. To approve any contract undertaken with a management firm for general administration services or full operation of the Corporation. g. To establish the guidelines and to annually approve the operating and capital budgets of the Corporation. h. To approve the auditing firm for the Corporation and any of its affiliated entities, and to accept the audit report. i. To approve the purchase, sale, lease, transfer, or mortgage of any real property of the Corporation. j. To approve all debt obligations of the Corporation in excess of a threshold established from time to time by the Corporate Members. k. To approve all major fund drives. l. To approve the merger, consolidation, or dissolution of the Corporation and to approve the plan for such disposition as proposed by the Board of Trustees.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990 goes to the Audit Committee for review and approval and then it gets final review and approval from the Board of Trustees before being filed with the IRS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A conflict of interest questionnaire is completed on an annual basis and reviewed by both the Audit Committee and the Board of Trustees.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: President compensation process: The trustees use the Wisconsin Association of Independent Colleges and Universities annual executive compensation report as the primary tool in determining compensation. Performance is evaluated on an annual, written basis, and the salary is commensurate with length of tenure and level of performance as measured against established goals.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
